info.headline: Dense Fog Advisory issued November 20 at 4:31AM EST until November 20 at 9:00AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...DENSE FOG ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Visibility dropping below one quarter mile in dense fog. * WHERE...All of east central Florida. * WHEN...Until 9 AM this morning. * IMPACTS...Hazardous driving conditions due to low visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...At 430 AM, surface observations, satellite imagery and traffic cameras showed areas of dense fog had formed across east central Florida, especially across the interior counties of Lake, Seminole, Orange, Osceola and Okeechobee. A weather spotter recently reported visibilities had dropped to less than a few hundred yards in the Orlando area. The dense fog will continue past sunrise, then gradually burn off by 9 AM.
info.instruction: Drivers should prepare to encounter significant reductions in visibility this morning, especially during the rush hour commute. Consider leaving early so that you can arrive safely at your destination at a safe driving speed. When driving in dense fog, slow down, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.
